Pours a dark brown body that looks black in the glass. Big frothy tan head. 

Aroma is slightly burnt, brown sugar and stone fruits. 

Taste is smooth with flavors of sweet coffee, chocolate and toasted malts and brown sugar. 

Smooth mouthfeel, oily texture.
Keg at The Bat. Dark brown. Nose is big roasted coffee beans, light dried fruits. Tastes coffee, roasted malts, cocoa.
Keg at hanging bat. Opaque black. Nose of coffee, dark chocolate, spices. Taste is dry, some dark fruit, burnt toffee.

28. 5. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Potent little rascal, almost black with brown silky head. Low head retention. Aroma is under control, flavour is roastiness, coffeeness, nice mix actually which kicks in in the aftertaste and not immediately. Well played.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle enjoyed at home
Pours quite dark, black in glass, thick creamy tanned head. Smell of cocoa, roast, dark malts, hints of coffee. Moderate sweet, alot of chocolate at first, then roast and dark malts, coffe comes with the tail; medium to heavy bitter. Great porter!

Varje år får polisen in en hög anmälningar om försvunna personer. När man dricker Põhjala Must Kuld inbillar man sig att de, om inte verkligheten vore så ryslig, kanske bara har gått vilse i detta snår av smaker. Det här är en provkarta över porterns förlovade land. Glöm inte kompass bara, den behövs när dimman rullar in.
Les Berthoms Rouen. Une Porter originale de par son côté lacté et doux qui contrebalance larôme et le goût de café. Le goût du café sexprime ici surtout par lamertume.

Aroma: roasted dark malt malts, lactose, bitter chocolate. 
Appearance: jet black and brown head.
Taste: roasted dark malts, bitter chocolate, cocoa, smooth, slightly smoky, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: great Porter, nice roasted notes, smooth.
Bottle at home. Taste of sweet, peppery liquorice, old coffee with cream and blackberries.

Bottle. BBE May 2017; Drank May 2017 - Opaque very dark brown / black in colour. Medium foamy beige head. Very malty; roasty malts, chocolate, liquorice, coffee, caramel, lactose. Dark fruits, raisins. Sweet roast chocolate and liquorice malty throughout. Drying finish. Nice flavoursome easy drinking porter. (2017-05)

Bottle. Dark, nearly black body. Medium tall beige head. Aroma has warm roast with hints of coffee. Sweet roasty taste with milky sweetness. Sweet roasty finish with some chocolate. An entirely enjoyable porter with a good strenght. This will pair nicely with various desserts.

Oily, black colour and a creamy, dark tan head. Light aroma of chocolate and a hint of roasted malts. Ligjt bitterness in taste, lots of chocolate and coffee flavours, medium roastiness. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel, light carbonation and medium body. Very good porter with lots of rich flavours.
Bottle, 330 ml from Primo, Ljubljana. Pours dark brown with light brownish head. Coffee, chocolate, lactic, malty, roasted, heavy sweetness. Bit sticky. Oily. Medium bodied. Bit too sweet for me.
Ciemne, niska, ciemna piana. W aromacie kawa, kakao, delikatna wanilia. W smaku dosyć słodkie, kawa, kakao, alkoholu brak. Delikatnie muśnięcie ciemnych owoców pod koniec. Bardzo dobry porter.

.33 L bottle from NickD717, thanks bud!

Pours a nice deep, dark brown color with a creamy light brown head. Roasted coffee, milk chocolate. Bit of lactose. Drinks fairly sweet, but theres enough of a dryness from the roast to balance it out.  Smooth, rich, milky mouthfeel.  Nice stuff.
Aroma of molasses, cacao, coffee, milk. Mouth: Quite thin mouthfeel. Taste: dark sugar,caramel,cacao,milk chocolate.. Easy drinkable and complex.
Kolsvart med ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar massor med kaffe och choklad! Söt och lite tunn

Pours black with brown foam that disappears rapidly, lots of carbonation..
Aroma; Molasses, cacao, coffee, milk.
Mouth: Quite thin mouthfeel.
Taste: To the sweeter side in the beginning with a somewhat roasty finish. The same notes as above mentioned. 
Easy drinkable and really a decent porter but with no great surprises.

Best before 22/11/2017, aperta il 13 aprile 2017.
Marrone molto scura con riflessi caramello, schiuma ocra di persistenza medio-bassa.
Aroma di melassa, caffè torrefatto, cioccolato al latte note di uva passa e ancora più leggere di prugna, lievi ore ossidate.
Al palato attacca con melassa, note ossidate ed uva passa, successivamente cioccolato al latte, finale molto gradevole e prolungato con cioccolato fondente, caffè e note di uva passa ed un lontano ricordo di amarena.
Corpo pieno, poco carbonata, setosa.

Pours black from the bottle and leaves a creamy, tan head. Aroma has roasted notes with milk chocolate, and something both dairy and sour, like sour cream or yogurt, and just a faint touch of ink. Overall the aroma remains rather restrained. Perhaps better so. Taste is bitter, lightly sour, turning increasingly dry and sour in the finish. A touch of chocolate and coffee. Mild hazelnut in the aftertaste. Makes an assertive and balanced impression. Palate has a touch too much carbonation at the outset for my taste in this style of beer; a bit prickly at the outset, but not enough of a disturbance to ruin the overall impression. Over the 25 minute session it settled to a more pleasant level. Alcohol remains perfectly disguised. Overall, despite a few flaws, a very good brew.

A great one! Tasted in Parma (IT) in the "Birrificio Del Ducato" 10th anniversary event. Tap poured by the Põhjala BrewMaster. Appears brown-black with a persistant brown foam. Aroma is roasty and with stringe coffee notes. 
Mouthfeel is superbe with a middle creamy body, you can feel a very clear coffe beans tast, blended with a note of chocolate and a well-balanced maltation. A really good coffee porter that deserves one more try!

0,33 l bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with big light brown lasting head. Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, coffee, dried fruit, brown sugar, alcohol is also noticeable. Flavor is sweet, full of roast malt, chocolate and coffee, lactic acid that ends up in long, slightly sour and very spicy medium bitter finish. Alcohol gives pleasantly warm feeling in the stomach. Body is full, texture creamy, carbonation is average. Im slightly bothered by overly spicy bitterness, but otherwise nice nightcap.
0,33l bottle. Nose: roasty coffee notes, slight hint of sourness, melasses. Taste: sweet, coffe, roastyness, juicy grassiness in the end.
Donker bier met mooie compacte mokkakleurige schuimkraag die langzaamaan inzakt. Aroma en smaken van (gebrande) koffie(bonen), licht houterig, rook, chocolade. Lekkere bittere afdronk. Mooie porter.

Draught at TAKA, Rīga. Dark brown with a healthy khaki head. Opaque with some visible carbonation. Chocolate milk, white coffee, and bay leaf in the aroma. The taste starts sweet and creamy but theres a bitter, almost citrussy hop that assets itself progressively more toward the end of the sip. The finish remains quite bitter despite the chocolatey aftertaste. Body as smooth as youd imagine, and the alcohol is surprisingly well hidden. Balance is good but not perfect - the bitterness feels a bit against the run of play, as it were - but make no mistake: this is still an excellent drop.
Вкусный портер, приятны& аромат, мощный вкус, много жженки во вкусе, легкая горчинк& приятно& послевк&

330ml bottle from smakpiwa.pl
Sour coffee aroma, roasted scents. Sour coffee taste with sour finish and some slight coffee bitterness in the aftertaste. Full bodied

Pitch black color with a quickly dissolving, finger-high dark beige head. Medium body, medium to high carbonation, no lacing. Slightly metallic aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, honey, dark fruits (plums, raisins), molasses and woody aromas. Taste is moderately sweet with flavors of milk chocolate, licorice, espresso, roasted malts, biscuits, rye bread and some vanilla. Slightly bitter aftertaste, creamy texture and easy drinkable. After Öö, Põhjala Brewery surprised me again. So far, my favourite Estonian brewery.

0.33 l bottle from Alko Arkadia. Visual apperance is like Guinness ruby/black. Aroma has espresso. Taste is like double espresso with sugar and dark chocolate. Yap, this has no roasted barley. Contains lactose, so this is a cross-over between porter (high ABV) and milk stout (sweet). Quite tasty indeed.
Szép sötétbarna szín. Nincs sok habja. Illata malátás, édes. Az ízé csokoládés, malátás, édes. Nagyon bejött.

En voilà un Porter de très haute voltige ! Limite Black IPA ou Imperial Stout, clairement ! Versée noire débène, transparence inexistante, mousse beige à souhait, voir brune ! Nez sur les malts torréfiés surpuissant, un alcool vivifiant, de la résine, du bois, du café et du cacao amer en veux tu en voilà, des notes suaves de pruneaux, de figue et de banane séchées, de la noix et de la noisette, du sirop dérable, du cuir, du miel de châtaigne... Pas franchement le nez dun Porter mais clairement celui dun Imperial Stout ! En bouche, le cacao et le café sautent à la figure, les levures viennent jouer des coudes dans la foulée, lamertume vient claquer comme un fouet pour nous laisser subitement sur une texture douce, huileuse, salvatrice. La brûlure et ensuite la Biafine ! La seconde gorgée persiste sur les levures, vraiment présentes et pas masquées par lalcool discret et lamertume cacaoté vraiment prenante. La troisième sarticule sur les malts cara et chocolat, le fond de commerce véritable de cette bière. Pourquoi je la compare à un moment donné à une Black IPA ? Parce que lamertume est costaude et très, très longue et fait immanquablement penser à une IPA. Mais cest un Porter grâce à sa texture, incroyable de douceur malgré cette avalanche dastringence. En fait on ne sait plus trop, et cest ça la force de cette bière. Très honnêtement je ne mettrais pas la note suprême car il me manque le petit je ne sais quoi qui me fait craquer, peut être un alcool trop sage, (je viens de menfiler précédemment une Troubadour Obscura qui ma juste mis une gifle...), mais très franchement, très grand cru que cette Must Kuld (ma première Estonienne, youpi !) qui tape allègrement dans plusieurs styles sans en pervertir aucun. A tester à tout prix ! Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

Black with a brown head - Roasted malt aroma with some coffee notes - Good roasted malt body with some notes of coffee and chocolate with some bitterness - The roasted malt and coffee flavour with bitterness goes into the finish - This was good

330 mL bottle. The pour is a darker black with a thin ring of creamy dark khaki head and a few spots of lace as it descends. The aroma is pretty good. There is a nice bitter roast and a light chocolate. A light creamy lactose and light honey really tie it together on the back end. This is creamy and pretty good. The milkiness does just enough to offset the bitterness. The flavor is just as good. The creaminess up front balances and sets the tone. Light chocolate and a bit of honey with a hint of bitter roasted malt tie it all together. The mouth feel is creamy and medium bodied with a softer carbonation and a libnerigly bitter and lactose sweet finish with just a touch of honey. This is surprisingly good.

Bottle, 330 ml. A fantastic, cortadocoloured head. Licorice, tar, vanilla, fudge, cough drops, coffee, chocolate - the full monty! Taste is full - really full. Dry finish but long-lasting. Excellent stuff.
Coffee, some cocoa, dark brown with a good tan head, medium body, low carbonation, very easy to drink, roasted notes with coffee in th final...very simple but great porter.
Black with dark fluffy head that fades away quickly. Aroma and flavour have plenty of sweetened coffee and milk chocolate. Theres a slight hint of smoke too. Quite thick and lucious.

Bottle at silja serenad. Bid and lasting dark brown head. Clear very dark red black color. Mich dark roasted malty aroma with-a-tuch of dark chocolate. Also a bit of strange herbal tuch that lovers the rating. Milk sweetness and balanced roasted malty taste with a balanced bitterness. A bit sour finnish.

Bottle from Elysium a long time ago. Aroma: Chocolate, some coffee, maybe vanilla, caramel. Appearance: Black body, cool head. Taste: Sweet, lots of milk chocolate and coffee, caramel, some tobacco biterness. Palate: Semi-sweet finish, medium-high body, low carbonation.

Pours pitch black ,topped with a medium small dark cream colored head, pretty lasting. Mild roasted nose with some berry fruity nozes, a bit of bourbon and a touch of vanilla. Sweet and chocolatey start, some dry fruits, vanilla with some roastiness in the finish. Just a hint of alcohol, but very nicely hidden. Creamy, medium body. Very drinkable.
Nõrga jõuetu aroomiga, ilma eriliste maitsenüanssideta keskpärane rüübe. Tunda ainult mõrusus ja alkohol. Enam ei ostaks.
Aroma: coffee, roasted barley, alcohol.Appearance: dark with small brown head.Taste: malt bitterness, coffee, burnt malt.Palate: medium body, light carbonation.

Bottle. Almost black colour, large, slowly diminishing beige head. Aroma of milk chocolate, molasses, coffee, mild honey notes. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter, chocolate, espresso, some molasses, lactose, cocoa. Roasty, bitter finish, coffee aftertaste. Medium+ body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Very good.

Piwo czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana brązowa, obfita, sporo się utrzymuje i tworzy ładny lacing. W nosie kakao, kawa, czekolada, to wszystko mocno intensywne. W smaku słodko, pierwsze skrzypce gra mleczna czekolada, potem kawa i paloność. Goryczka niska, posmak palony.

33cl bottle. Very dark mahogany pour with a medium height tan head. Notes of caramel, milk chocolate, molasses, roasted malt, dark chocolate, cocoa nibs, cherries, plums, espresso. A very nice beer, full bodied, delicious, very well balanced between sweetness and bitterness. The best Must Kuld I have tasted, quite a bit better than their counterparts.
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 Bottlw 330cl @ home. Pours black with light brown head. Nose is cocoa and malt. Taste of cocoa, malt, a bit of lactose. Very nice mouth feel. A Perfect birthday gift.

Bottle. Black with a medium to large light brown head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate and twigs in the nose. The flavour follows the nose with roasted malt, cocoa, dark chocolate, twigs, dark wood and light earthy notes. Medium body, medium sweet and bitter with mild acidity. Roasted finish. Fine.

on tap dark good head bitter cocoa medium body medium-low bitterness light warming good roasty note chocolate 
 scura buona schiuma buona persistenza cacao amaro discret corpo amaro piuttosto contenuto un filo riscaldante buone tostature cioccolato amaro

330ml bottle. Quasi black colour with average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, beige head. Roasty, chocolately, dark malty aroma, notes of cocoa, fruity lactic hints of bramble, blueberry, yoghurt, cautious smoky overtones. Taste is moderately sweet dark malty, roasty, lactic hints of yoghurt, fruit yoghurt (bramble, blueberry), some cocoa, hints of treacle and roasted nuts; perfectly hidden alcohol, high drinkability.
33cl bottle. Deep dark brown/black with a nice beige head. Roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Bitter. Very good.

from Erzbierschof - black beer with no head retention; roasted aroma of tobacco, honey and hazelnuts; sweet and with a subtle carbonation; tasty and full-bodied; a late solid bitterness; lactic chocolatey and honeyish, toasted malty finish

Bottle. Pours almost black with small dark beige head that quickly dissipates without visible lacing. Strong roasted malts aroma, dominant chocolate and coffee with some milk and alcohol in the background. Bittersweet taste of roasted coffee, cocoa and chocolate that continues in medium roasted bitterness, lasting pretty long and touch of alcohol warmth at the very end. Medium bodied with creamy/silky texture and soft carbonation. Very nice.

Deep brown with frothy, dissipating, thin mocha head. Chocolate and dark coffee aroma with some molasses and alcohol. Taste is roasted coffee with smokey and ashy flavours towards the end. Alcohol is discretely present. Very creamy and smooth. Medium body, low carbonation. Mildly bitter finish. Beautiful.

Das Porter "Must Kuld" (Schwarzes Gold) von Pöhjala präsentiert sich schwarz mit einer cremigen braunen Schaumkrone. Der Duft ist wunderbar malzig schokoladig, leicht rauchig. Im Mund zeigt sich eine tolle Komposition an Aromen: Röstmalz, Schokolade, etwas Kaffee, dunkles Brot, etwas Rauch. Und das ganze in einem wunderbar cremig weichen Körper. Der Abgang ist leicht bitter und ist lange präsent. Runde Sache!
33 cl. bottle. A black beer with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, licorice, sweetness, caramel, coffee
Potezna swiezo mielona kawa w aromacie, ktora przykrywa wszystko. W smaku bardzo podobnie.
Dark brown, small and weak coffee head. Chocolate and roasted aroma with some wine notes. Medium body, refreshing, mild with clear roasted flavor. Bitter roasted aftertaste. Good.
330ml bottle. Aroma has liquorice and bit of alcohol. Taste is roasred malt with alcohol notes. Warming stuff.
Frisch vom Hahn im Hopfenreich. Fast Schwarz undurchsichtig mit beiger Schaumkrone (leider schnell weg). In der Nase etwas unauffällig. Schöne Schokonoten. Keine aufdringliche Röstigkeit.

F: big, dark brown, good retention.
C: dark, opaque.
A: roasted malt, dark fruits, liquorice, cacao, hint of coffee, hint of lactic.
T: dark chocolate, coffee, cocoa, dark dried fruits, earthy, caramel, dark bread, medium to full body, medium to high carbonation for this style, good balanced, smooth mouthfeel, BB: 01/02/17, 33cl bottle from Struise Bruges Beer Shop in Bruges.
Tried twice. Worth to keep this beer for some time in cellar. Full, nice body, caramel, chocolate, malts, brown sugar, bit of lactose and coffee. Very, very complex. Great one.

Bottle. Sensoric. Very deep brown with large, frothy, thick, light brown head. Moderate head retention and lacing. Moderate to heavy malty aroma, roasted (mainly chocolate than some coffee), caramel, molasses, sugary - brown sugar, some lactose. Also some licorice and in the background some wild berries notes. Taste is moderately sweet with nice, quite long, moderate bitterness. Medium body, oily and creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is nicely bitter, smooth, ashy, roasted, lactose, coffee, very complex. Summary: I have to say WOW, this is really drinkable, complex porter, vast of aromas, vast of sensations, not nasty acidity, neither dulness. Podsumowanie: Naprawdę niezły porter o złożonnym aromacie, to jest wersja podstawowa, ale i tak bogata w owocowe aromaty. Piwo doskonale zrównoważone i pijalne. Każdy znajdzie tutaj swoje klimaty. Do doskonałości trochę mu brakuje, ale jest and cozy pracować. Pohjala kolejny raz mnie pozytywnie zaskakuje.

Bottle from beer52 beer club. Very heavily malted, leaves a slight powdery aftertaste. The coffee notes are strong, perhaps too strong. Im not convinced that there are any chocolate notes though. Its very rich and not something you could have multiple of. Probably for the best given the strength.
0,33l Flasche. Schwarzes Bier mit schöner cremiger Schaumkrone. Intensiver Geruch nach Röstmalzen, Kaffee und Schokolade. Schmeckt auch so intensiv, Kaffee und Bitterschokolade stechen hervor. Toll!

Bottle: Black color, rocky brown head. Aroma is malty, roasty, dark chocolate, nuts, coffee. Flavor is sweet and roasty, notes of dark chocolate, roasty cacao beans, ome coffee, dry cacao powder, some notes of dark dried fruits, hints of black currants and cherries. Ends roasty with roasty bitterness, dark chocolate and coffee notes. Dense brew, very tasty.
Silky choco-coffee mix. Well ballanced, very malty. Nice hazy mouthfeel. Kind a sweetish but not in the bad way.

33cl bottle. Dark brown with a thick head. Smells chocolatey and nutty, a hint of red wine and yeast aromas. Very creamy mouthfeel, chocolate ice cream flavor (not overly sweet) and a bit of alcohol. Lasting coffee bitterness. Very enjoyable.

33cl bottle from Beer52.com. An opaque peaty brown colour with a dense tan head; rich roasted malt aroma with some chocolate; smooth and silky in the mouth with chocolaty taste and a sweet biscuity body - like a liquidised plain chocolate digestive biscuit; then a drier finish with some coffee and grounds, and with the lactose coming through; and finally a gentle warmth from the well-hidden alcohol. A sensuous beer, perfect for sipping on a cold evening.
0,33l bottle. Pours black with thick brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, sweet chocolate and caramel. Taste is bitter/sweet. Very well balanced. Bitter end. A very good porter.

W aromacie raczej słodko, mleczna czekolada, czerwone owoce i niestety lekka szmatka. W smaku słodkie, niezbyt dużo ciała jak na 7,8%, pozostawia czekoladowy posmak, goryczka niezbyt wysoka. Jak nie lubię piw z laktozą, to to jest całkiem znośne.

tap/strefa piwa. czarne, coca-cola, biała piana utrzymująca się w postaci niewielkiej obrączki. aromat kakao, słody palone, czekolady, kawy zbożowej, po ogrzaniu herbata z miodem. w smaku zaskakująco pełne, początkowo wyraźnie słodkie, na finiszu kwaskowate, nasycenie trochę za wysokie. lacing minimalny

Bottle at home. Pitch black colour, good lightbrown head. Nose is roasted malts, cocoa, light coffee. Intense and mouthwatering. Taste is medium bitterness, intense roasted notes of cocoa light earth and coffee. Longlasting aftertaste. Full mouthfeel. Very nice!

From tap. Dark chestnut brown with a beige head. The aroma is moderately malty - roasted malt and very pleasant. Very good silky texture. Taste of roasted malt, caramel, light coffee with a light bitterness in the finish. Excellent and very well balanced.

Nieprzejrzyście czarne, z bujną, ciemno beżową pianą. Aromat słodki, rodzynki, cola-cola, trochę czekolady. W smaku dominuje kawa i paloność, są rodzynki, jest wyraźna kwaśność od ciemnych słodów. Goryczka średnio-niska, wysycenie niskie.

Estonia is so hot right now! Not literally - Im way south in Bulgaria and its "must kuld" (most cold) here. Well I just ticked the Topeltnelson and it was cray legit, and now Im ticking this, and I think I just need one word: Scoreboard! This is also an unusually good beer. The name means "black gold" in Estonian, and it is just that. Darkest brown in color with a small tan head. The aroma initially jumps out as complex and pleasant, with dark chocolate, anise, damp earth, dark fruits, nuts, honey, and vinous notes. The flavor is just sweet enough to balance the considerable bitterness. Nutty and chocolatey, a touch of smoke. Medium-bodied and very slick. Drinkable for a relatively high-ABV porter. Very good overall.
Aroma of roasted malts, lactose and little fruitiness. Taste of chocolate and very nice smoothness from lactose

Draft 0.15l at Craft & Draft Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 20.09.2016. Taste with Vlada and adamnowek. Pour it dark color with small brown head. Aroma roasted malt and some milky notes. Taste of roasted malt, dark chocolate, milky feel, sweet licorice finish, nice balanced, good Porter, medium body, creamy, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2016 Pitch black with big brownish head; aroma is coffee, cacao, coffee-chocolate, a hint of alcohol; taste is medium sweet, dark chocolate and coffee, cacao, fades into bitter roasted long-lasting finish, some warmth from the alcohol, there is always a underlying sweetness which makes a nice balance; mouthfeel is creamy a little syrupy with medium carbonation
Bottle at pub. Pours black with medium sized tan head. Aroma has roasted coffee, cocoa and caramel. Taste is coffee and cocoa with a hint of honey. Long finish with cocoa. Excellent.

Ciemno brunatne. Piana bardzo drobna, brązowa, gęsta o obfita. 
Świetny aromat, czekolada, śliwki. Jest owocowo i laktoza. 
Całość pachnie jak smaczne czekoladowe ciasto. 
Są nawet lekkie nuty ciemnego miodu. 
W smaku czekoladowe, mniej nut owocowych. Ale w drugiej nucie wyraźne śliwki. 
Niska goryczka.
Piwo jest gęste, lekko oleiste. 
Niewysokie wysycenie, świetnie się pije.

Pours black color, clear, with foamy on finger light brown head. Aroma: .malt aroma takes on toffee, toadted, chocolate, hint of coffee, supported with intense note on dark fruits, like blueberries, strawberries, plums...
Flavor is very similar, also with note of lactose, hint of honey....finish is sticky, dry, bitter, hop bitterness is medium and with spicy, citrusy notes. Body is medium, texture soft, carbonation moderate medium.

Nearly pitch black. Good and dense mocha head, decent retention, scarce lacing. Aroma shows dominant chocolate malts plus hints of milk coffee. Its strong and clean but very much monotonous. As the smell suggested taste has a very sweet foundation, with milk chocolate and notes of vanilla. Notes of roasted malts and coffee can be detected in a balanced enough finish and aftertaste. Again, clean and vivid but monotonous. Medium body, very light crispness, nicely silky and decently creamy. Clean and enjoyable sweet stout/porter. Not too complex.
Black color with beige head. Aroma is black chocolate and coffee. Taste is more black chocolate, molasses. Full-bodied, medium carbonation.Great!

great beer!! 
dark brown color,
chocolate and coffee aroma
moderate bitterness
Bottle shared. Pours nearly black with dense dark brown head. Aromas and flavors: caramel, black bread, chocolate, coffee. Mild bitterness in aftertaste. Very good.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2016 Very dark brown with a small tan head. Rich aroma of toffee, balsam, coffee, dried prunes/figs/dates, spice, chocolate, cookies, vanilla. Assertively bittersweet with a touch of roasty sourness. Full body, low to medium carbonation, oily texture, sticky and warming finish. A wonderful porter - rich and well balanced.

I det närmaste svart med stort beiget skum. Doft med milda rostade toner av mörk choklad och bara aningen kaffe, plus lite mörka frukttoner. Mild smak med fina rostade toner av choklad och lite kaffe, en behaglig lite fruktig sötma. Rund och fin munkänsla. En riktigt bra porter i den lite sötare och mildare stilen.

Aroma is complex van koffie, likeur, ingemaakte kersen, chocolade met zoete tonen ertussendoor. Smaak is iets gedrongener, minder zijdeachtig en flexibel. Wel rijk aan kruiden, koffie, gebrand suiker en andere zoetigheden. Geen kraag op bijna zwart.
Bardzo dobry porter i nic dziwnego ze top30. Piana drobna, dosc szybko Anikajaca. Wysycenie niskie, fajnie ukryty alkohol. Zapach/smak: kawa/czekolada/w Apachu dodatkowo palonosc. Dobre piwo.

Kolor: ciemnobrunatny, klarowny.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, dość trwała.
Zapach: sporo kawy, aromatów biszkoptowych, czekoladowych, kakaowych, lekka paloność.
Smak: wyraźna pełnia, trochę słodowej słodyczy, sporo kawy, czekolady, kakao, średnia goryczka, kawowa, lekko palona.
Wysycenie: średnie.
Black colored beer with a small white head. Taste is strong coffee, hoppy, strong bitternis, fruity . Special taste.
Pours black with a nice beige head, aroma of chocolate, coffee, caramel, bread, flavor of chocolate, coffee, caramel, dark bread, medium bodied
Tap. Nice roasty aroma, smooth chocolate and dried fruits. Taste is sweet, light bitter. Tasty.

Dark brown, thick brown head. Aroma: chocolate, malts, lactose, red fruits and after heating alcohol. Medium to light body, medium sweetness. Malty flavour with ester fruits and some roasty notes. Some sour and lactose notes. Low bitterness.

Acclaimed Estonian porter - probably famous because of its suggestive label, and I must admit that I too misinterpreted it until I bought a bottle and got a closer look at it... Well, it is an original means of attracting attention, to say the least. Medium thick, moussy, creamy, pale yellowish beige head consisting of densely packed, tiny bubbles retaining well on the edge and as a thin beige membrane on the surface of the liquid, which in itself has a black colour revealing its deep, warm wine red hue on the edges. Strong aroma of cured meat, veal stock cube, bitter cocoa, caramel, cold black coffee, toasted walnut, black tea, lots of iron but not feeling unnatural, stewed beef, noga, candied date, burnt sugar, fresh oyster mushroom and even a very faint hint of vanilla. In the mouth, I get sweet, sour and umami in a nicely balanced combo: underlying basic black fruit sourishness, dried fig and even very light brown sugar sweetishness and soft dried meat- and mushroom-like umami, none of which really dominates the other. The iron effect from the nose comes forward at an early stage, as a kind of metallic sound all the way through, thinly resting on top of a smooth, creamy malt body, starting with caramelly sweetness but very quickly turning bitterly toasted and ending even a tad coffeeish. Finishes with this mouth cavity-coating toasted bittersweetness, a bit oily, along with a peppery and floral hop accent, retronasal toasted bread and dried fruits and a dash of warming but otherwise non-intrusive alcohol. I am used to porters and stouts having a certain amount of iron character, but in this one it really struck me both in the nose and in the mouth. Still, it has enough aroma, flavor and body to tolerate this and in fact, it distinguishes it a bit from the rest. I love porters and this one is a very good, heavily toasted example - so toasted in fact, that it could just as well have been labelled as a stout, but never mind: lovely beer. And not just for the label.

OMG. I have no words. If God would be available in liquid form, I think this comes close to what in would look like. Maybe this is it. The looks are amazing to start with. The color of the beer is pitch and pitch black on the naked eye. When seen with a bright light a extremely dark reddish brown color shows. But, it still looks almost black. The beer pours a beautiful yellowy brown soft creamy foam. When pouring, a lot of foam forms, but a lot of it collapses in with the time. A nice layer of creamy foam remains on top of the beer till the beer is finished. The smell of the beer reminds me of my vacation in Dublin, where weve drunk a lot of amazing porters in places like J.W. Sweetman and the Porterhouse Brewing Company. Comparing this beers with the beers there is the biggest compliment I can give. The smell has a rich and strong roasted barley aroma. This gives the beer a strong bitter aroma. I love this. The beer also had a delicious sweet and sour fresh hop aroma. The combination between the strong roasted aroma, reminding me of coffee and roasted cacao beans, and the hop aroma is truly define. Only porters have this amazing combination. This smell retrieves so many good memorys. A beer that is able to do this, is a great beer. After you are done with the amazing smell of the beer, there is also a heavenly taste to discover. The beer has a strong bitterness, focused by the coffee and cacao been like flavors of roasted barley. There is also a tremendous freshness, doused by the hops. This gives the beer a slightly sweet and sour taste. The taste also has a beautiful sweetness, which forms a beautiful balance with the bitter roast flavor. The beer has a very nice palate. The carboxylation is just perfect. The gas bubbles are tingling happily upon your tongue. The beer also has something creamy. It is just perfect. It really finishes a great productive day. Im happy now. 
If I close my eyes, I have the idea Im in Dublin drinking an Irish beauty. Only in on The Netherlands, and my beer is Estonian.

Pours like a chocolate muffin in a glass. Beautiful black dark color with a foamy Duvel-ish brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, nuts, chocolate, thick molasses and dried fruits. Strong nose, truly beautiful. Taste is much like dark chocolate. Beautiful balance between bitter and sweet. Beautiful roasty bitter tones. Tones of brown sugar and nuts as well. Some subtle vanilla tones... Great raisin-like aftertaste in which the hops come to the forefront. Warmish as well, with beautifully hidden alcohol. Beautiful creamy and thick texture, sticky mouthfeel and smoothly carbonated. Perfeclty balanced and incredibly smooth and milky. One word: wow. Enjoyable in every sip. Beautiful brew, definitely a world-class Porter.

0,33l fles gekocht bij slijterij van pernis. Diep donker bruin met een bruine fijne kraag. Geur is cacao maar ook baileys. Smaak begint goed zoet met, honing, chocoladémelk baileys en vormt in de afdronk om naar drop. Plakkend mondgevoel dankzij de lactose.
Dark brown with light brown creamy head. Sweet aroma. Strongly bitter and at the same time pretty sweet taste rich with chocolate, vanilla and coffee notes.
0.33 bottle. Great appearance. Coffee. Roasted caramell. Third time trying it. Really love it.

Iso ja semivakaa viipyvä kahvimainen punertavan ruskea vaahto. Mustanruskea väri. Tuoksu luumuisan intensiivinen. Suutuntuma kuohuvan hapokas, lievästi metallisen vetinen lämpöisenäkin, jälkituntuma kolamaisen alkoholinen. Maukas ja hyvä mutta ei nouse lähellekään parhaita porttereita.

33cl bottle. Poured black with a thick creamy espresso head. Roasted malty, licorice, dark bready notes. Flavor has licorice, roastedness, sweet bread, plums, hops. Long sweet roasted finish. Excellent.
Balck body, brown head. Aroma has roasted malts and some dark caramels with medicina hops. Flavour is more rounded and has nicer notes to it.
Bottled. Pours pitch black with a huge brown head. Smells salty, roasted malt, coffee. Tastes coffee, salty, dark chocolate with a similar finishy.

Look; beige top, black body. crocheted lacing. 
Aroma; sweet coffee, caramel, sweet-salty ham. 
Taste; big bowl of dark fruits, dark chocolate, sweet coffee, prunes, black toffee  leading to a slightly dry fruity dark finish. 
Creamy texture, nice. Good porter, a tad sweet, couldve been baltic porter.

330ml bottle, #054, shared by djoeye. The oily pour creates a lasting espresso head, crocheted lacing and a deep black body. Sweet aroma of roasted malts. Grainy chocolate flavours supported by prunes and toffee. Sweet malt driven ending, roasted. A slow beer with sipper qualities. In danger of getting overly sweet (Tromsø 27.07.2015).

Nimensä mukaisesti mustaa nestemäistä kultaa. Täyteläinen ja paksu ruskea vaahto. Tuoksu ja maku ovat erittäin paahteisia. Kuvauksesta huolimatta hunajaa en löydä, sen sijaan tulee mieleen tumma 90% suklaa. Ei liian katkeraa, pehmeä tumma olut.
Too sweet for my taste. But with the help of four friends just the right amount of it.

33 cl bottle from Tallinn. Põhjola makes great value brews Ive noticed. These one is exceptional in value. Rich creamy, toffee infused nose. Beautiful dark looks. Really smooth rich palate with flavor of smoked toffee rye bread. Positive in all ways. Definitely will buy again.

Aroma of cocoa and roast just after opening. Tastes very silky and you can get a wide range of flavor. Dark chocolate, honey, cocoa, bitter roast and malty sweetness. All-in-all its very smooth and enjoyable.

330 ml bottle. #049. BB 23/01/16. At the Bryggeri Helsinki, Helsinki, Finland. 
Black colour with a huge frothy tan head. 
Roasted malt, ash, bitterness, berries and oatmeal in the aroma. 
The flavour is sweetness, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt and bitterness. What are we seeing on a label? 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: shaker:
Black beer. Beige light brown head.
Aromas of roast, liquorice, light chocolate, some soy, dried leaves, bay leaf...
Flavour of smooth roast, vanilla, chocolate, cacoa, bitter, hint of soy, coal...
Aftertaste bitter, roast, coal, dark choxolate, light liquorice...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, more than just medium bodied.
Good balanced!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Joes. Opaque dark brown to black color, medium to full sized light brown head. Dont get any aroma really, hayfever prevents me from judging this well enough, so Im going with what my tasting buddies tell me. Taste malts, a touch of liquorice, a little sweet, some roasted malts, dark fruits. Medium body and carbonation.
Bottle @ joes. Dark brown to black colour with a large light brown head. Smells maple syrup, burned meat, sweet, weird. Tastes maple syrup, spareribs, sweetish roasty. Medium body, soft carbo.

Bottle from European local swap, many hanks to VamboladeTolly. Very dark brown color with huge beige head. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malt in aroma. Taste, coffee, dark coffee, licorice in taste. Medium long coffee bitter finish. Good.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 Bottle sample at a a tasting at troubles place. Thanks troubles. Black. Chocolate, roast, lactose, sweetish, licorice note, rounded mouthfeel. Very nice. 7/4/7/4/14=3.6

Bottle sample at a tasting at kerenmks place. Thanks Stas. Black with a big brown head. Nice roasty aroma with some chocolate and coffee. Rather dry flavor, slightly acidic, roasty, with a bit of lactose, a sweetish note, coffee, a bit of chocolate, and a bitterish finish. Medium-bodied, slightly over-carbonated. 7/4/7/3/14=3.5

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks Stas. Black with a gushy tan head. Nutty, caramel, a little burnt and wet bread aroma, sweet, nutty, malty taste that then turns dry and bitter with some coconut. Full body, well-carbonated, long, caramel, roasty finish. Decent.

Aroma of roasted malt, sourish coffee, cacao, milk chocolate. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with a moderate roasty bitter finish. Good one, sweetish but very rich, lots of tasty milk chocolate and coffee notes.

At a tasting, thanks, big gushing fluffy head, opaque black color, aroma of dark bread, some carob and cocoa and a hint of dates, flavor of dark bread, burned sugar some roastiness, cocoa and charred notes, relatively sweet. Nice and well made.
Pours dark with medium creamy head. Aroma: cocoa, chocolate, roasted malt. Taste: pretty complex, with coffee and chocolate dominating, at the same time pretty drinkable. Good one.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 Draught @ Bierfest Berlin. 
Very dark, very dense and thick caramel coloured head. 
Bitter with a lot of fruits, blueberry, blackcurrant.

Bottled from Lager Lager, 20.01.15. Dense mouthfeel, black coffee with a pinch of sugar. Forget the espresso, this is very good as a dessert, probably on its own.

Draft sample @ Berlin Braufest 2015. 
rune foncée, col café au lait.
Arôme est malté grillé sur un rétro café au lait voire fruité noire assez agréable. Retrouve un léger côté figue et date avec une fine note de lactose.
Palais est malté, grillé avec une petite douceur de lactose qui offre une palette de café au lait. Ce malté grillé et de café perdure et reste trs prenant au fil de la dégustation. Lamertume, quant à elle, est minimale laissant pointer qcq notes nobles UK.

330 mml bottle tasted on the 12/05/2015. Pours black with a thick brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, chocolate, coffee, cocoa and lactic notes. Taste is smooth, roasty and chocolat with hints of coffee, cocoa, vanilla and milky notes. Finish is smooth, with coffee and chocolate. Well balanced beer. Nice logo.

On bottle with Visionthing, thanks a lot! Bbdate 27.12.2014.Black color, good foam. Medium/ high aroma intensity; barrel influence, autumn leaves, roasted. Medium body & medium/ high complexity. Good sourness- some bitterness. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle, pours black with a bubbly tan head, cherry is big on cherry, with chocolate and caramel, molasses. Sweet with a silky, light creamy texture, which thins in the mouth giving way to roasty, long bitter finish. Fine, lasting carbonation.

bottle at homa, ive got some mixed feeling when looking at the label.. dark brown poured with a tanned head. notses of sweet chocolate, roasted malts, yoghurt, coffe vanilla, milk, coffe, cookie dough, lactose, slight tart aswel.. not my kind

Keg at Bishops Arms Folkungagatan, Stockholm.  Near black, mid sized beige head. Milk chocolate, tobacco and raisins up front. Very sweet with medium body and clean mouthfeel. Milky chocolate, plenty of caramel, some metal. Sugary finish. Quite primitive.
Whats Brewing 2014. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, licorice, chocolate, lactose. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, licorice, chocolate, lactose. Nice beer.

330ml bottle from Uba ja Humal, Tallinn
Pours pitch black with a thick brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, chocolate, coffee, cocoa and hints of lactic notes. Taste is smooth, roasty and chocolatey with hints of coffee, cocoa, vanilla and milky notes. Finish is smooth, robust and rich with some roastiness, milky coffee notes, chocolate and vanilla. Nicely balanced and tasty porter.

Draught at Brewdog Helsinki. Black color, brown head. Bitter/sour taste with coffee, acidic notes, cream, nuts, dark fruits, raspberry and roasted malts. Bitter/sour finish with coffee, acidic notes, cream, raspberry and roasted malts. Very nice, peculiar porter.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede bruine kraag. Ruikt vanille, crème, specerijen. Smaakt zoetig, speculaas, vanille, iets bitter. Goede dikke structuur.

Pik zwart met een mooi beige bruine kraag. Ruikt chocolade, deeg, geroosterd, vanille. Erg goed. Smaakt chocolade, koffie, deeg en geroosterd. Koffie bitter nasmaak en ook iets van alcohol en zoetigheid. Iets teveel carbo, ook iets te dun. Voor de rest prima.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, coffee, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, thick feel, lively carbonation, bitternes finish
Overall- very good

Bottle (shared with friends).
Complex and intense taste with many layers. Chocolate, coffee, raisins. Good and enjoyable porter.

Appearance: black liquid with tan foam. Aroma: caramel, bread, chocolate, roasty, coffee, licorice, smoke. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: medium body, slick feel, average carbonation,

Bottle 0,33l. Pours black color with nice big tan head. Aroma roast bread, coffee, dark chocolate. Taste burnt malts, coffee, alcohol, chocolate. light body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter finish.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Big sweet milky chocolate aroma, chocolate liqueur, vanilla, soft and warm. The flavour is also big, sweet but not over the top, mostly malty not fruity, moderate roast, moderate hop bitterness. The finish is sweet with mild astringent and alcoholic notes.

Draught at Olhops Craft Beer House, Valencia. Pitch black - offwhite head. Nice burned. Acid. Light honey flowery notes. Lactose - almost milkey in the finish. Smooth body - but a bit thin in the finish. Light berries. Some bitterness. Charcoal. Light tarmac. Light smokey notes.
Jet black. Slightly soapy tan head. Aroma is roasted coffee and molasses. Taste is brown sugar, dark chocolate, roasted malt, and a charcoal barbecue. This is delicious.

330ml bottle from Pantori, San Sebastían. 28-01-2015.
BBD: 27-05-2015.Batch: 034.
In short: tasty porter.
Pours black with nice tan head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Coffee, cacao, roasty aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is roasty, moderate bitter, coffee, cacao, spicy, some honey notes. Warm aftertaste. Very enjoyable.
UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 black, tan foam, caramel, bread, chocolate, roasty, coffee, licorice, smoke, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation,

Bottle 330ml. @ [ (pre-Christmas tasting ) by chriso - London ]. [ As Põhjala Must Kuld ].Clear dark brown color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, molasses - lactose, sweet malt - sugar. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, licorice, molasses, roasted, chocolate, lactose - sugary. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20141207]

As not a fan of porters I liked this one really much. Our northern neighbours know how to make a good beer as well as Malduguns does. Mild, a bit milky, you can not feel the alcohol that is there. Loved this one!
Bread, roasty aroma. Brown colour, frothy brown head. medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour.

On tap at Whats Brewing. It pours a dense, two-finger light tan head over a more or less black body. Roasted malts, licorice, dark chocolate, caramel sauce and brown sugar in the flavor. Creamy, full-bodied and lightly warming in the mouth, semi-dry. It has a light roasted bitterness in the flavor, with a decent sweetness. Roasted malts, licorice and dark chocolate, some dark sugar. Lasting finish. Nice this one, thats for sure. 141231

(Põhjala Must Kuld) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter. Thannks to jookos! ABV 7.8%
Black coloured body with a tall and very thick brown head sitting on top. Very good retention, light lacing left on the glass as the foam slowly collapses.
Aroma has plenty of milky chocolate, coffee is following along with roasted malts and light vanilla aroma.
Taste has also lots of chocolate, roasted malts, cocoa, hints of hops, the honey is not so notable, maybe a bit on the aftertaste. Something peppery too.
Medium body with good carbonation.
Very good, enjoyable.

0,33 l bottle 
chocolate, roasty, caramel, herbs, brown, hazy, rocky head, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2015 Black, dark brown head. Roasted malt and chocolate on the nose. Wonderfully balanced bittersweet, roasty, toasty, chocolate and coffee notes. Finishes a bit disappointing, vague bitterness. Quite good.

color negro con espuma beige de consistencia media aunque duradera. Aromas de maltas tostadas, café azúcar moreno y ligera vainilla. Cuerpo medio, inicio moderadamente dulce con final de amargor tostado y acafetado,
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2014 Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en tienda XXXII. Color negro. Sabor a malta, regaliz, dulce.

33cl bottle at Chrisos Christmas tasting, London. It pours a dark brown color with medium mocha head. Aroma is very sweet with notes of toffee and caramel. Taste is again sweet with candy sugar and bread. Finishes lightly bitter. Overall, certainly sub par, but love the label

330 ml bottle
Black beer with big brown head. Aroma has milkchocolate, rye bread, light roastiness and woody bitterness. Flavor has chocolate, cream fudge and roasted malts. Full palate with quite strong carbonation. Finish has a strong bite of bitterness, extended with alcohol. Aftertaste has also fudge, coffeey acid and salmiakki. A decent sweet dessert porter.

Bottle shared at chrisos pre-Christmas tasting. Pours deep brown with a thick, frothy beige head. The nose has mellow roast, earth, some wood, coffee. Medium sweet flavor with some marshmallows, cocoa, dark berries, dirt, bitter earth. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Moderately sweet on the finish with some toasted marshmallows, subtle vanilla, bitter chocolate, toasty bread. Very nice.

Bottle shared at chrisos winter tasting 7/12/2014. Aroma is nutty earthy, praline, hint of spices on the nose as well Dark caramel brown coloured pour with a lasting light tan head. Some soy on the nose as well. Flavour is composed of dark bitter chocolate, praline, nutty malts, some lactose sugars. Palate is medium full bodied with a little bit of sweetness. Lingering burnt sugar and bitter roast.
Dark black color. Light brown color. Oatmeal and dark chocolate color. Smooth, med full body that is fairly sweet. A touch of molasses. A touch cloying. Not my fav, but ok.

Bottle. Deep dark brown color. Cream, roast and a hint of licorice in the aroma. Chocolate milk. Chocolate milk flavor with roast and ash. malty. Sweet. Almost full bodied. Some warming alcohol. Roastbitter finish. Very good, though the lactose affects the drinkability a bit.

Tap at Pudel Baar, Tallinn. 
Opaque black color, small beige head. Coffeeish, chocolaty, sweet aroma. Medium-bodied. Front is sweet dark chocolate and syrup. Then some bitterness and roasted flavors. Coffeish, licorice and even some cough syrup. Smooth and all right. Perharps a bit sweet.

Bottle and tap @Naiiv
Pours with nice brownish head. Aroma is maybe too sour. Aroma bread, chocolate, resin, woody. Taste is great, mayby a bit too watery. Somehow more rounder when its from tap and a bit more balanced aswell. Aftertaste almost only dark choclate. Overall: rather good

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2015 31.10.2014, tap sample @ Whats Brewing:
Big brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, dark sugar, butterscotch, sweet licorice, lactose, dark malts, grass, soy sauce, butterscotch. Taste is slightly sour-ish roasted, dark malts, sour coffee, grass, paper, lactose, licorice, cocoa, wet hay, roasted grain. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh and watery mouthfeel. Fair enough.

330 ml bottle. Poured clear brown color with an average frothy brown head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted coffee and earthy aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy roasted sweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met with a solid drinkable beer.

Sampler at What´s Brewing 2014, Stavanger. Black body, small light brown head.. Roasted raisins and liquorice on the nose. Smokey, sweet roasted flavor and a hint of coffee. Full bodied and a long roasted finish.

On tap at Whats Brewing, Stavanger. Pours black with a big creamy tanned head. Aroma of coffee and dark malts, weak roast. Taste is moderate sweet, light smoked, weak roast, smooth and creamy, nice.
 .
Sample on tap at Whats Brewing Beer Festival, Stavanger. Black colour, lasting tan head. Roasty aroma, a bit ashy. Fairly sweet flavour, roasty, molasses, liquorice, lactose.
On tap at Whats Brewing 2014, Stavanger. Pours black with cream-coloured head. Chocolate and milk with some toasted aroma. Tastes surprisingly sour; chocolate, sour milk.
Bottle from drink shop, tallinn. Aroma is balanced roasty, coffee. Full roasty body, coffee, chocolate.
Richly layered, extremely complex (for Estonia) stuff, though was expecting something a lot smoother. This one overdoes the hops and definitely overemphasizes the toasted-caramel elements

Bottle @ De Tolly joogipood, Tartu, Estonia.
Pours with thick creamy brown head. Aroma of coffee, dark burnt bread, some sweetness (honey/raisins?). First zip made it all warm and cosy inside :) 
Taste of little bit alcohol, burnt chocolate, hint of burnt malt and aftertaste is long with reasonable bitterness, alcohol and roastiness.
Impressed.

33 cl @ Keller.
Gooddamn this one is gooood shit.
Rather modest coffe/choco aroma, bit sweet. Coffee like foam, dissapaears quickly. Tastes soft yet rich. Superb balance. Nice bit bitter palate. One of the best indeed.

0.33L bottle. Sweet cappuccino, caramel and whipped cream aroma. Dark brown with massive top what vanishes for few minutes. Coffee, sweet raisin, dark bread, honey, vanilla, cocoa powder taste. Maybe to sweet for a porter. Very light smoke flavor in the end. Enjoyable bitter overcoojed bread mouth feel.
Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours dark brown (black) with medium brownish head. Aroma of roasted caramel,coffee. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, chocolate. Full bodied. Soft carbonation. Good beer.

Quite a cocoa bomb in nose. Lovely dark choco, cocoa, some roasted malts, light vanilla, molasses. Same goes for taste, starts quite smooth thou turns bit harsh in finish, thou overall quite creamy mouthfeel.
Moderate sweet with light bitterness. Very nice brew, well balanced and enjoyable. Love cocoa

Aromats: WOW, kakao pupina, mazliet rieksti, laktoze, ogas. Izskats: Tumss bet mezgine atri pazuda. Garsa: Salds, laktoze, kakao pupina, kas paliek ilgi, balanss perfekts. Maza gaze :) Vnk tapec ir verts braukt uz Igauniju

Bottle shared thanks to jmgreenuk. Pours near black with a beige head. Aroma of toffee, fudge, sweet malt, raisins, chocolate. Flavor is over moderate sweet and bitter. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

bottle courtesy of and shared with JMGreenUK.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear deep brown pour. Lovely and smooth. very enjoyable

Bottle from a Tallinn supermarket. Poured a dark mahogany with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is sweet caramel malt. The flavour is moderate sweet with a creamy malt toffee caramel hop bitter palate. Moderate to full bodied with soft carbonation. Estonian brewing is improving.

Very beautifyl and thick foam. Aroma is sweet, little bit coffee in it and reminds me a portwine. Very smooth and creamy taste, like a whipped cream. Just a little bit watery but the end is nicely bitter.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2014 Dark brown/black pour with large, beige head. Very fruity on the nose, with chocolate and some hazelnut. Also a slightly funky, sulfuric note that goes away. Taste is smooth for 7.8%, sweet and fruity on the palate with some roast on the finish. Moderate carb and mouthfeel.
reis ümber maailma ka jõuluõhtu kodus- kõik se ühes rüüpes! magus-hapu-kreemjas-kohvine-ploomine

33 cl bottle @ Timo A.
Pours black color with a small off-white head. Cocoa and dark chocolate on the nose, faint wooden notes, some coffee also. Chocolate and coffee dominant on flavor, faint vanilla also. Moderately bitter malty palate, short dry finish. Extremely tasty.
4326

330 ml bottle. Thanks Timo A. Pours a black colour with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate and licorice. Flavour of rich roasted malts, burnt bread, coffee, dark bitter chocolate, honey sweetness, biscuit and some cream. Full bodied and oily mouthfeel. Really soft and nice mouthfeel. Great stuff.

330ml bottle courtesy of Ashton McCobb, split with jeevan. Pours black with a decent tan head, Aromas are dark chocolate and coffee all the way... yum! Taste brings some dark fruit to the mix, still lot of coffee and chocolate going on. This is their best beer, no doubt.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2014 
33 cl bottle @ home. Batch #010: BBE 27.12.2014. Thanks mjs!
Aroma is heavy and sweet with cocoa, toasted sugar and syrup. Flavour is sweet with syryp, toasted sugar, cocoa, molasses and nuts. A bit too fizzy palate. Reminds me of some oversweet east European dark lagers, but this one has balance and more body.

Black bread in aroma,dense foam that lasts. Smooth taste with roasted coffee and black bread. Still bitter. Can feel alcohol but not overwhelming. Can during as a long during with some desert instead of coffee.

Bottle from Pohjala Chris. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - dark chocolate and coffee with a creamy backdrop. 
Taste - dark chocolate plus booze and dark fruit.
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy and sweet texture through the middle section and although the finish is sweet it is appropriate for the start and finish. 
Overall - this is great. It should be in the Imperial Porter style category.
Bottle, Label is ugly. But beer was good. Very dark brown body, little creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts. Chocolate and more coffee in taste, also some fruits. Medium sweet. Nice.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, nose is dates, chocolate, taste is sweet roast malts, fruity, rich cake, bitter.
Bottle thanks Ash. Black with tan head. Aroma is roasty. Taste of chocolate, roasty, dried fruit. Sweet. Nice

Bottle at Craigs. It pours darkest brown with minimal white head. The nose is earthy, toasty, cocoa, roasted malt and weak coffee. The taste is roasty, toast, plum skin, liquorice, dirt, date, earth, light pepper with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Mikes berry than the paint stripper beer. Still ok at best.
Bottle at home.... Deep black... Thick tan head.... Dark roast meaty malts... Dark chocolate malts nose... Dark chocolate coffee roast.... Deep malts... Big sweet chocolate
Bottle. Deep brown color with a hige foamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and peat. Sweet taste with some bitterness. A bit oily feel. Medium thick body.
Dark brown, brown head. Nose is bready malts, roast, lactic notes. Flavor is roast, malt, some coffee notes, alcohol and earthy roast in the finish. Thinner than expected, goes down easy.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Pitch black color, big brown head. Sweet aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, smoke. Sweet, lightly sour and bitter taste has dark roasted malt, hops, dark chocolate, licorice, syrup, hint of herbs and bacon. Medium body and soft carbonation. Nice porter.
0,33 pullo@ Hopner. Tummanruskea, lähes musta. Tuoksu sivistyneen paahteinen ja Kahvinen. Suutuntuma hyvä, maku miellyttävä eikä kitkerä tai kuiva. Tumma suklaa maistuu pienellä kitkeryydellä.

0,33l bottle @ Hopner. Pours very dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, alcohol and some coffee. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, alcohol and hops. Very oily and soft mouthfeel. Great stuff.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - batch 010 - BB 27.12.2014, at Koht, 20140715) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had coffee, chocolate, burnt malts and sweetness. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, chocolate, coffee, burnt malts and bitterness. Afteraste had chocolate, cocoa and bitterness. A bit too much on the sweet side but otherwise nice brew.

Bottle from Tallinna Kaubamaja ( 3), July 2014. Batch 010. The laconic label features an unsharp photo of a roasted malt seed that, as one critic put it, looks a bit frivolic - true that. Pours a deep brown, black in the glass with a huge creamy head. Nose is rich: sweet, dark chocolate, even sugary-syrupy notes and roastiness most notable, some sharpness there too, maybe recalling a bit of liquorice, also slightly ashy. Taste is very sweet, chocolaty-syrupy, burnt sugar, and a good deal of alcoholic warmth there too. The roastiness comes only after that; finish is bitter, a bit sour even. A smooth, soft, creamy texture - I see perfectly what the lactose does here, too bad I cant stand the damn thing. Very soft carbonation, medium to full body. If you ever get cravings for a big fat chocolate cake, this here would be a good alternative. Too sweet for my taste; plus, the lactose makes my tummy feel like a war zone.

33cl bottle. Malts and raw coco aroma. Pours pitch black with dark brown, chocolaty head. Rather sweet, and it makes it a good desert porter. It is oily and smooth, but not watery. Thickness is there, and it is not transparent at all. It is a good summer sweet porter - the one you finish your evening with.
